heading: Maggie Bittarelli
whatIsNow: (This is a now page, and if you have your own site, you should make one, too.)
lastUpdated: Updated October 29th, 2024, from the Greater Boston Area, MA

updates.heading: I'm reading tons of books with my toddler
paragraphs: My kiddo has been interested in reading since he developed even a modicum of an attention span. We'll read short books over and over, and longer books (60, 70, 80 page picture books) from start to finish in one sitting.
Favorites of the moment are 'Bing, Bang, Chugga, Beep', 'Room on the Broom', and Busytown books.

updates.heading: I'm cooking our family's meals
paragraphs: Since our toddler started eating solids midway through 2023, I've been cooking/prepping his meals from scratch, trying to use as many whole foods and diverse flavors as possible. We eat as a family, and the goal has always been to cook one meal for everyone. 101 Before One really helped make this feasible for us, and we still use their recipes and guidance even well past our kiddo's 1 year mark.

updates.heading: I'm building and thinking
paragraphs: In the past few weeks I've begun designing and building a website for a local business, as well as creating this site from scratch.

Someday I hope to join forces with a team of developers as supportive, scrappy, intelligent, and empathetic as the last team I was on. To that end, I'm perusing job openings in this tough job-seekers market, practicing skills by creating, and studying things I may be interviewed on but have never had to use professionally (traditional data structures an algorithms).

updates.heading: Sleep tight, garden
paragraphs: Where I am, frostier times are imminent (although, Happy Halloween - it's going to be 80 degrees F today!). I enjoy putting my community garden plot to bed, prepping it to be productive next year. In our yard, getting ready for winter largely entails leaving things as they are - all sorts of beneficial birds and bugs depend on dead flower stalks and leaf cover to survive the winter or plant eggs in.
